english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Allah has made mercy into one hundred parts (or mercies).'

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn al-Muthanna
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn al-Muthanna ibn Abdullah ibn al-Muthanna al-Ansari

narrators.name: Yazid ibn Harun
narrators.full_name: Yazid ibn Harun ibn Yazid ibn Usama al-Azdi

narrators.name: Hajjaj ibn Abi Zaynab
narrators.full_name: Hajjaj ibn Abi Zaynab Muhammad ibn Abdullah al-Hudhali

narrators.name: Abu Uthman al-Nahdi
narrators.full_name: Abd al-Rahman ibn Muhammad ibn Uthman al-Nuhdi
reliabilityIssues: ambiguous transmission term from mudallis, though generally acceptable

narrators.name: Abu Hurayrah
narrators.alternative_names: Abd al-Rahman ibn Shakhr, Abu Hurayrah

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Abu Uthman al-Nahdi uses indirect transmission term (عَنْ) with Abu Hurayrah, though he is generally considered reliable by majority of scholars

potential_issues.issue: Abu Uthman al-Nahdi (Saduq) uses indirect transmission term (عَنْ) with Abu Hurayrah
potential_issues.impact: While Abu Uthman is generally considered reliable by the majority of scholars and his narrations are accepted, the use of indirect transmission term introduces slight ambiguity in the direct connection. However, given his overall reliability and the strength of other parts of the chain, this does not significantly affect authenticity.

Topics: Description of Allah's Mercy and the Hundred Parts of Mercy

english_translation: [Biographical Dictionary Entry - Not a complete hadith for analysis]

potential_issues.impact: This is a biographical reference or narrator criticism note, not a complete hadith with matn and isnad suitable for isnad analysis

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The least of the people of Paradise will have ten thousand servants attending upon him.

narrators.name: Musa ibn Ismail
narrators.full_name: Musa ibn Ismail ibn Maslamah al-Tabouni

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Salim
reliabilityIssues: Unknown narrator - not clearly identified in hadith literature

narrators.name: Abu Khalifah
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Hazm al-Hudhali or similar
reliabilityIssues: Saduq - acceptable but not highest grade

narrators.name: Abu Hurayrah
narrators.alternative_names: Abd al-Rahman ibn Shakhr, Abu Hurayrah

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Multiple unknown narrators (Muhammad ibn Salim and Abdullah ibn Mu'abbad are Majhul)
Weak intermediate links in the chain
Abu Khalifah (Saduq) is not highest grade

potential_issues.issue: Muhammad ibn Salim is an unknown narrator (Majhul)
potential_issues.impact: This is a significant weakness as the narrator is not clearly identified in hadith literature

potential_issues.issue: Abdullah ibn Mu'abbad al-Zumani is also an unknown narrator (Majhul)
potential_issues.impact: Another major weakness in the chain with an unidentified narrator

potential_issues.issue: Abu Khalifah is Saduq (acceptable but not highest grade)
potential_issues.impact: Reduces the overall reliability of the chain

potential_issues.issue: Multiple indirect transmission terms (عَنْ) throughout the chain
potential_issues.impact: Accumulation of indirect terms further weakens the chain

Topics: Description of the blessings in Paradise
Rewards for the believers in the afterlife
